channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: At least 2 killed as storms lash the Northeast
item.description: Two people were killed as storms ripped through the Northeast, unleashing strong winds and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands of customers.

item.title: Neighbors pitch in to help clean up
item.description: Neighbors started picking up the pieces after severe storms hit Elmira, New York. WENY's Joe Melillo reports.

item.title: Games to begin, officially
item.description: One of the biggest secrets in London will finally be revealed Friday: what will happen at the opening ceremony for the Summer Olympic Games.

item.title: Weird Team USA pics go on display
item.description: Kristie Lu Stout shows us the widely panned pictures of Team USA about to go on display in art gallery

item.title: Competition begins
item.description: Photos: Olympics get under way

item.title: Murray to Katherine Jackson: Visit me
item.description: Conrad Murray, the doctor convicted in Michael Jackson's death, is inviting the late pop star's mother to visit him in jail to "answer any questions she might have."

item.title: Jackson 'laughs' at stroke report
item.description: Katherine Jackson's lawyer met with her Thursday evening for the first time since her Arizona trip that led to her losing custody of Michael Jackson's children.

item.title: $1B Jackson estate causing feud?
item.description: Michael Jackson's estate is worth an estimated $1B, but family members contend that's not what they're fighting about.

item.title: Lawyers: Sandusky messages released
item.description: Attorneys for a victim Jerry Sandusky was convicted of abusing have released two voice mails they say the former coach left their client just prior to his 2011 arrest.

item.title: Message to victim: 'I love you'
item.description: Attorneys for one of Jerry Sandusky's victims released a voice mail they say Sandusky left on their client's phone.

item.title: Syrian rebels amass as battles intensify
item.description: Syrian rebels prepared for a fresh onslaught Friday by setting up medical clinics in apartments and homes throughout Aleppo, the country's commercial hub.

item.title: Hepatitis suspect had been fired before
item.description: The man accused of infecting patients with hepatitis C at a New Hampshire hospital was fired from a job in Arizona two years ago after testing positive for cocaine and marijuana, a public relations agency for Arizona Heart Hospital said Thursday.

item.title: 5 accused of terrorizing Jewish camp
item.description: Three adults and two juveniles were arrested Wednesday for allegedly terrorizing a Jewish camp in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Al Qaeda's 'last chance' for a country?
item.description: Islamic radicals linked to al Qaeda have seized the northern half of Mali, one of Africa's largest nations, and there are widespread concerns that the region could soon become a terrorist haven.

item.title: Navarrette: Guns endanger cops' safety
item.description: When an elected official whose heart seems to be in the right place offers a courageous perspective on an important subject, I'm inclined to try to find some good in it.

item.title: Dying dad to daughters: 'I love you'
item.description: Gordon Cowden's daughter was with him when he was killed in Aurora. She and her brother share memories of their dad.

item.title: Twitter apologizes for global outage
item.description: Social networking site Twitter apologized for a worldwide outage Thursday that left the site inaccessible for more than an hour. It blamed the outage on a technical fault and said that despite speculation, it wasn't related to the London Olympics, which open Friday.

item.title: Video shows SeaWorld orca attack
item.description: CNN's Tom Foreman reports on a 2006 killer whale attack at SeaWorld.

item.title: 'Twilight' cheater stirs fan furor
item.description: Showbiz Tonight takes a look at the backlash Kristen Stewart has been getting for cheating on Robert Pattinson.

item.title: Hubby pulls 'meanest prank ever'
item.description: A notorious practical joker gives his wife a rude awakening during a road trip. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Facebook fans 'lonely'?
item.description: A report on Facebook, Bill O'Reilly and the Fox "brand," Current TV"s new hire, a Pulitzer for a PA reporter, GMA rises

item.title: New show 'too white'?
item.description: HBO's 'Girls' is the latest TV show depicting life in New York City without one of its most crucial elements: diversity.

item.title: Zimmerman's body language
item.description: An expert in body language says George Zimmerman showed signs of anger in court in Florida.

item.title: Anderson battles on 'Jeopardy!'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on the highs and lows of his past "Jeopardy" appearances and weighs his odds of winning.

item.title: Steinem on GOP and women
item.description: Activist and author Gloria Steinem analyzes the "war on women" and says extremists have taken over the Republican party.

item.title: Working moms of CNN
item.description: CNN goes behind the scenes with the working moms on Suzanne Malveaux's team to see how they juggle it all.

item.title: Levon Helm remembered
item.description: Anderson Cooper takes a look back at the life of The Band's Levon Helm and his many contributions to music.

item.title: Man makes dating spreadsheet
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses the investment banker who created an elaborate spreadsheet to keep track of his dates.

item.title: Political dog tale duel
item.description: In the RidicuList, Anderson Cooper examines which candidate's dog tale will have a greater election impact.

item.title: Vanessa Williams' perfect man
item.description: Entertainer Vanessa Williams talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about "being properly in love" and relationships.

item.title: 'Only in America': Defending Axl Rose
item.description: Piers Morgan defends Axl Rose for deciding not to attend the Rock'N'Roll Hall of Fame induction of Guns N' Roses.

item.title: Rep. won't name 'Communists'
item.description: Rep. Allen West (R-FL) responds to criticism after he claimed a number of Democratic reps in Congress are Communists.

item.title: RidicuList: Quest for 'sexy veggies'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper riffs on a staple of Courtney Stodden's grocery list, "sexy veggies."

item.title: Kim Kardashian for mayor?
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses Kim Kardashian's comments about running for Mayor in Glendale, California.

item.title: New judge in Martin case
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to a panel of analysts about the new judge in the Trayvon Martin shooting case.

item.title: Witness: No agenda; just shooting people
item.description: As victims of the Aurora shooting are mourned, survivors recount moments of unspeakable terror.

item.title:
Suspect was 'book-
smart type guy'
item.description: The 24-year-old man police say opened fire early Friday on a movie audience was a doctoral student at the University of Colorado School of Medicine in Aurora.

item.title: Neighbor almost opened rigged door
item.description: Efforts to disarm the Colorado theater shooting suspect's apartment left evacuated neighbors on edge.

item.title: 'I didn't think we would get out alive'
item.description: Survivor Jamie Rohrs talks about his escape from gunfire when shots rang out in a Colorado movie theater.

item.title: Shark victim: Protect great whites
item.description: A string of deadly shark attacks off Western Australia is no reason to undo laws protecting great whites, says attack survivor Mike Coots.

item.title: Watch woman flip scooter on escalator
item.description: Authorities released video of a woman trying to ride her scooter up an escalator to discourage others from attempting it.

item.title: How to make peace with a monster
item.description: They're members of a grim fraternity, survivors of some of the most notorious mass killings going back decades. Their advice for Colorado shooting survivors: Don't be quick to forgive.

item.title: Colorado shooting re-created in 3D
item.description: Investigators can use sophisticated technology to analyze complicated crime scenes with multiple victims.

item.title: Small kids punched and kicked at daycare
item.description: HLN reports a 9-year-old boy in Mississippi is caught on camera punching and kicking children at a daycare center.

item.title: 5 guys take same photo for 30 years
item.description: When five teenagers sat down and posed for a picture at Copco Lake in 1982, they didn't plan on making it a tradition. But it's become the tie that binds lifelong friendships.

item.title: Suspect's son brawls with witness
item.description: The son of a man accused of killing his wife gets into a fight with a witness for the prosecution outside the courtroom.

item.title: Photos: Olympian outtakes
item.description: Photos: Olympian outtakes

item.title: Watch man survive 96,000 foot fall
item.description: Lisa Sylvester reports on Skydiver Felix Baumgartner - who survived a test jump from 96,000 feet, falling at 536 mph.

item.title: Evita note: Please buy with me, Argentina
item.description: The face of Argentina's most famous first lady is part of a new design for the country's currency.

item.title: Ridiculist: Welcome to Bikinis, Texas
item.description: The owner of a sports bar named 'Bikinis' in Texas has bought the town of Banker Smith and renamed it after his bar.
